page.title: 19Annual Steam Rally,Sellindge
page.content: The Steam Rally is held in May on Spring Bank Holiday Sunday and Monday at Hope Farm off Swan Lane.It was first held in 1970 after the Elham Rally was stopped and was begun by Mr. Les Birch,the landowner and steam enthusiast.It is mainly a display of historical agricultural machinery,but includes competitions for traction engines and rollers as well as static displays of vintage vehicles and steam machines.Exhibitors come by invitation from all over Britain and in the week prior to the Rally,many steam vehicles pass through the village.About Â£9000 is needed to stage the Rally,so a fee is paid by spectators.In 1970 any profit was given to Sellindge Playing Fields Fund,but now that project is finished,the money is given to local hospitals and groups in the village who have helped with the organisation.
